column4: Vivendi bought more Telecom Italia shares in Dec -filing
column5: MILAN  Jan 15 Top investor Vivendi  bought more ordinary shares in Telecom Italia in December after securing four seats on the Italian company's board  a filing by Telecom Italia showed on Friday.

column4: Toyota Philippines targets 10 pct output growth in 2016
column5: MANILA  Jan 15 The Philippine unit of Toyota Motor Corp is increasing its output by a tenth this year and preparing to tap Manila's $600 million incentive programme  its president said.

column4: Fitch: USB's Good Performance in 4Q15 Supportive of its High Ratings
column5: (The following statement was released by the rating agency) CHICAGO  January 15 (Fitch) U.S. Bancorp's (USB) fourth quarter 2015 (4Q15) and  full year 2015 earnings continued to be strong and support the company's  ratings  which are the highest in Fitch Ratings' global bank rating universe.   USB's 4Q15 return on average assets (ROAA) 1.41%  down modestly from the 1.44%  in 3Q15.  The company's 2015 full year ROAA was 1.44% relative to 1.54% in the  prior year period. column4: United Continental CEO headed home after heart transplant
column5: United Continental Holdings Inc  said on Friday Chief Executive Oscar Munoz is headed home after a heart transplant last week and is recovering well.

column5: Jan 15 United Continental Holdings Inc  said on Friday Chief Executive Oscar Munoz is headed home after a heart transplant last week and is recovering well.

column5: Jan 15 United Continental Holdings Inc  Chief Executive Oscar Munoz said on Friday he was recovering well after a heart transplant last week.

column4: UPDATE 1-Wal-Mart merges tech teams to better connect online and stores
column5: Jan 15 Wal-Mart Stores Inc is merging an Arkansas-based division that develops computer systems for its stores with a fast-growing technology unit in Silicon Valley  aiming to hasten its move to compete in the online era.

column4: Wal-Mart pulls plug on smallest stores  shuts 269 locations
column5: Wal-Mart Stores Inc  said on Friday that it would pull the plug on its smallest store format  Walmart Express  and close 269 locations as it contends with higher costs in its home market of the United States and disappointing results overseas.

column4: UPDATE 3-Wal-Mart pulls plug on smallest stores  shuts 269 locations

column4: Wal-Mart pulls plug on smallest store format  shuts 269 stores
column5: Jan 15 Wal-Mart Stores Inc said it was pulling the plug on its smallest store format and closing 269 stores globally  including 154 in the United States  in a restructuring that will affect 16 000 workers.

column4: Fitch: Wells Fargo Reports Solid 4Q15 Results
column5: (The following statement was released by the rating agency) CHICAGO  January 15 (Fitch) Wells Fargo & Company (WFC) reported fourth quarter  2015 (4Q15) results of $5.7 billion in net income for a return on assets (ROA)  of 1.27%  down 1.5% from last quarter. Earnings have remained relatively  consistent over the last five quarters  hovering at  around the $5.7 billion  mark. column4: CORRECTED-Wells Fargo profit falls 0.8 pct
column5: Jan 15 Wells Fargo & Co  the biggest U.S. residential mortgage lender and a major lender to the energy industry  reported a 0.8 percent fall in profit for the last quarter of the year as it set aside more funds to cover bad loans.
